contentrichtext.text: {{refimprove|date=November 2010}} {{Infobox album <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> | Name = Rock around the Bunker | Type = studio | Longtype = | Artist = [[Serge Gainsbourg]] | Cover = Serge bunker.jpg | Released = 1975 | Recorded = November 1974 - December 2, 1974 | Genre = [[Rock music|Rock]] | Length = | Label = [[Polygram International]] | Producer = Alain Hortu | Last album = ''[[Vu de l'extÃ©rieur]]''<br />(1974) | This album = '''''Rock around the Bunker'''''<br/>(1975) | Next album = ''Je t'aime moi non plus''<br />(1976) }} {{Album ratings |rev1 = [[Allmusic]] |rev1score = {{Rating|4|5}}<ref>[{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r288308|pure_url=yes}} Allmusic review]</ref> }}<!-- Automatically generated by DASHBot--> '''''Rock around the Bunker''''' is a 1975 album by [[France|French]] singer and songwriter [[Serge Gainsbourg]], containing songs which combined pseudo-1950s musical arrangements with lyrics relating to [[Nazi Germany]] and [[World War II]] and drawing from Gainsbourg's experiences as a [[Jew]]ish child in [[German military administration in occupied France during World War II|occupied France]]. ==Track listing== All tracks composed by Serge Gainsbourg; except where indicated #"Nazi Rock" - 3:10 #"Tata Teutonne" - 2:48 #"J'Entends des Voix Off" - 2:05 #"Eva" - 3:13 #"[[Smoke Gets in Your Eyes]]" ([[Otto Harbach]], [[Jerome Kern]]) - 3:28 #"Zig Zig avec Toi" (Sieg Sieg avec Toi) - 3:39 #"Est-Ce Est-Ce Si Bon ?" (SS si Bon ?) - 3:16 #"Yellow Star" - 1:40 #"Rock around the Bunker" - 3:25 #"S.S. in Uruguay" - 2:16 ==Personnel== Serge Gainsbourg - vocals, piano, guitar *Kay Garner - vocals *Jean Hawker - vocals *Jim Lawless - percussion *Brian Odgers - bass *[[Alan Parker (musician)|Alan Parker]] - guitar *Judd Proctor - guitar *[[Clare Torry]] - vocals *Dougie Wright - drums *[[Alan Hawkshaw]] - piano Arranged by Alan Hawkshaw and Serge Gainsbourg ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Serge Gainsbourg}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Rock around The Bunker}} [[Category:1975 albums]] [[Category:Serge Gainsbourg albums]]
